sub_title: Software Engineering Manager at TomTom Automotive
summary:
I am an innate Software Engineering Manager at TomTom, located in Eindhoven (The Netherlands). I am a hybrid “beast” that brings together applied physics, engineering, leadership, project management, coaching and training skills.

Before TomTom, I worked at ASML for about 8 years as SW engineer, Scrum Master, Product Owner and Team Lead. Before that on the "Reliability assessment of NAND flash memories for space applications":

- as PhD Candidate at Politecnico di Torino (ITALY)
- in collaboration with Thales Alenia Space
- as Visiting Scientist at ESA’s European Space Research and Technology Centre (ESTEC), in Noordwijk (THE NETHERLANDS), in the Onboard Computer and Data Systems section

contributors.headline: Software Engineering Manager at TomTom Automotive

projects.title: EUV design and development for new ILIAS sensor
projects.description:
Design and development of new ILIAS sensor with ILIAS/PARIS SW team, physics team, with projection/illumination team and our metrology experts.
From high-level design impact, new litho and SW impact assessment to realization and test.

contributors.headline: Software Engineering Manager at TomTom Automotive

projects.title: DUV new development support for PARIS sensor
projects.description:
Support and new development of PARIS sensor with PARIS SW team, physics team, with projection/illumination team and our metrology experts.
Parallel ILIAS (PARIS) sensor allows for a parallel measurement of optical aberrations throughout the projection slit, thus enabling a more accurate alignment, improved reticle heating correction and on the fly lens heating correction.

contributors.headline: Software Engineering Manager at TomTom Automotive

projects.title: DUV/EUV sustaining support for ILIAS sensor
projects.description:
Support of ILIAS sensor for machines installed on-field, with ILIAS SW team, physics team and with projection team.
ILIAS is a phase measurement interferometer hardware integrated into high-numerical aperture (high-NA) to measure and analyse wavefront aberrations, for complex optical subsystems, across the full image field with high accuracy and speed.

contributors.headline: Software Engineering Manager at TomTom Automotive

projects.title: Latch-up Protection for COTS Memories in Space
projects.description:
Design and test an IP that allows block access to a memory bank embedding in it SEU/SEFI protection and redundancy means to have a guaranteed EOL size with multiple failure tolerance.
IP will be tested using commercial Field Programmable Gate Array (FPGA) technology and commercial SRAMs and/or FLASH, but with in mind future space use in rad-hard OTP FPGAs or Application Specific Integrated Circuit (ASICs), also as a possible protection module for SRAM-based reprogrammable FPGAs.
A test breadboard is produced, for integration with European Space Research and Technology Centre (ESTEC) future avionic systems testbed.

profile_positions.description: Software Engineering Manager within Automotive System Department. My Team is dedicated to deliver our products to multiple car manufacturers (e.g., Stellantis, Jaguar Land Rover and at least 5 extra OEMs). Responsible for people development, growth and resource allocation for 10+ people among Architects, SW engineers and testers spread over Europe and Asia.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineering Manager

profile_positions.description:
Team Lead and Product Owner of Reticle Deformation Correction (RDC) Functional/SW Teams within the Development & Engineering (D&E) Image Align Metrology group.

Main responsibilities: People management, Coaching, Resource allocation support to Project Leader and Group Leader, Plan Tracking, Risk Management, Product Release Strategy.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead

profile_positions.description: Product Owner in combination with Team Lead role
profile_positions.title: Product Owner

profile_positions.description:
Mentor at ASML Technology Scholarship 2016, a two-year professional development program for talented young entrepreneurs!
.
profile_positions.title: Mentor at ASML Technology Scholarship 2016-2018 and 2018-2020

profile_positions.description:
Functional Design Engineer in the Metrology group at ASML D&E. Metrology department is in charge of controlling and minimizing external/internal factors down to the nanometer scale, by means of measurements, modelling and process/functions optimization.

Main responsabilities as Functional Design Engineer in Metrology:

- Design, develop, realize, and test subsystems/subfunctions within the limits of system specifications, costs and project planning
- Design specifications creation for future development of our SW-colleagues
- System design for improved accuracy/throughput of ASML machines
- Problem solving
- Algorithms development and integration
- Mathematical models development for offline and online usage
profile_positions.title: Image Metrology Functional Design Engineer
